page.title: 12COMMUNITY COUNCIL 1
page.content: A Ratepayers' Association for Portnahaven and Port Wemyss was formed in 1965.In 1977{Strathclyde Region} proposed that{Community Councils }be set up.The local population felt it essential that there should be a Community Council for the two villages ie.Portnahaven and Port Wemyss,and not one joined to Port Charlotte or for the Rhinns of Islay generally.Portnahaven and Port Wemyss are 7-8 miles from Port Charlotte and the general feeling is that "We're at the end of the line and everything stops at Port Charlotte".The following are the main issues of 1985:- 1){Improvements to the water supply {both in quality and quantity 2){Street lighting and Road {Maintenance 3){T.V.Transmission,no B.B.C.Scotland {only Northern Ireland programmes.}
